snippet: The freed activist, Jeyakumari Balendran, is a central figure in an effort to find people who disappeared in the 26-year civil war, including her son.
abstract: Sri Lankan judge grants bail to prominent Tamil activist Jeyakumari Balendran, who has been engaged in task of finding people who went missing during country's decades-long civil war; case is broadly viewed as vital test of new government's desire to reconcile with nation's disaffected minorities.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and DHARISHA BASTIANS
byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from New Delhi, and Dharisha Bastians from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: The freed activist, Jeyakumari Balendran, is a central figure in an effort to find people who disappeared in the 26-year civil war, including her son.

headline.main: Sri Lanka Grants Bail to Tamil Rights Activist
headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka Grants Bail to Tamil Rights Activist

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
